Reviews.Title: “Cheap option for one or two nights.”
Reviews.Author: thirdstar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Castro Pretorio Station e not so far from Termini, what is a good point. The breakfast isn't bad, but without fruits or an apparatus to warm cheese in the bread. They can improve the breakfast with low investments. The room is old but very clean. There are several options in the cable TV. The staff is not friendly specially at the front desk. The elevator is for only two people. I was in the 6th floor and was always scared using it. If you will stay one or two nights in Rome it can be a huge option, but if you are looking for comfort avoid the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Dolly P
Reviews.Content: We just had to walk to reach the hotel from Roma termini, indeed close-by . Hotel is nice and quaint however my initial experience with the hotel receptionist was quite shocking !. The lady could barely handle pressure of handling 3 client who are peacefully standing in a queue to collect their room keys.they had serious issues with room check-in process , they would not let guest enter their rooms until 2 pm even if the earlier guest had vacated before 10 am. Was a bit peeved by their service at that moment . The rooms were standard , ok decor,clean sheets .bathrooms were clean. There are many dining options close-by . access to Roma tourist locations was very convenient through metro line 5 mins away from Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan W
Reviews.Content: Good location, could walk to most attractions, front desk staff were very helpful although we had to get over a bit of a language barrier as we only speak english and some staff only had broken english if any. Having said this we specified english speaking hotels when booking the trip. Our room was over a restaurant who cleaned up their bottles at 2am every morning, so a wee bit noisy. Our room was good - tv, small fridge, free wifi - bed was very hard. Breakfast was delicious a fantastic choice of cereal, cold meats and cheeses, cooked eggs, bacon, fruit juices etc - very yummy. The lift was tiny, so be prepared to go up one at a time with your luggage, we managed to fit two in at a time (with our luggage) but it wasn't easy :) also no tea & coffee making facilities in the room (but this may just be standard in Europe)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice..People not nice..”
Reviews.Author: nsgMumbai
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last destination in the Europe tour ( France - Switzerland - Italy). We had three rooms booked months in advance at San Marco. However, on arrival, we were told there was NO third room available! We had to literally argue our way through to get the required no of rooms. upon check in we realized that the bathroom of one of the room was stinking badly and the basin was out of water. We were in a generally nice mood and would not have cribbed but the front office manager was really rude. He made it look like it was our fault...almost! He refused to act on the situation and after a lot of argument agreed to even come up and inspect the room. After this initial issue, we thought the rest of the stay would be smooth, but the AC in two rooms was not working! there was a control panel in the room but the AC vent was empty...Again the manager said that NO hotels in entire Rome had AC...it was unbelievable as the third room AC was working just fine! The staff at the Bar was also equally rude. We needed some hot water. But they told us we can give you hot water but not the kettle/ any vessel to carry it in. They simple did not understand hospitality or even the fact that we were actually paying for our stay and not staying there free of cost. The breakfast was more than pathetic. Most of the bread was not even fresh. The three days we stayed there, we did not have breakfast even though we were booked on Bed & Breakfast basis. If the keep the staff behavior aside, the hotel is quite nice...value for money. Rooms are spacious enough. Metro station is near by and many eateries at a walking distance. But I am sure Rome out of all the places has hundreds of better options for hotel that offer the above plus hospitable staff. Considering we dropped a coin at the Trevi fountain ...! and will definitely return to Rome, we are certain that we will not stay at San Marco again and wouldn't advise anyone else to.

Reviews.Title: “Our bad exoerience”
Reviews.Author: Richard D
Reviews.Content: After flying all the way from Australia via Dubai,we arrived late afternoon in Rome to discover that the room we had payed for a MONTH ($856.00 A Dollars) before and which had been confirmed was not available..HUH!..They then panned us off to another hotel the Milani which after travelling around the world I would rate as the biggest dump ever.My wife was in tears and the stress was unbelievable...We did not stay at the Milani and were lucky to find an apartment courtesy of a local restaurant owner ....@ 70 Euros /Night...San Marco ..your incompetence and off handed attitude was breathtaking and I will spread the word

Reviews.Title: “Central location as a base”
Reviews.Author: andyj54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay for a base and is very centrally located a short walk from Termini Train Terminal. It is quite a noisy area but we didn't have too much touble sleeping. The breakfast selection was average.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Vabrant
Reviews.Content: Well located, near train/subway stations, comfortable, spacious rooms, mini bar, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great experience. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWithTots999
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel San Marco to be a great, value hotel. The staff was informative and accomodating. The location was extremely convenient and we were able to walk to virtually all of the sights in Rome. This small hotel was exactly what I expected based on their website, online reviews and room rates. I would definately recommend and stay again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Very average 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyagywonok
Reviews.Content: Pros: - location - in the city centre, only few steps from Castro Pretorio metro station; - free Wi-Fi. Cons: - very small room with small windows. We were unlucky to have a patio view room. The patio is like a well and there is a feeling that no daylight comes inside the room. - limited breakfast (not enough before a busy day in Rome, I stayed hungry after eating it). All in all - nothing special but it could be an option if you have a good rate here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: NikkiandAaron
Reviews.Content: Bare bones, but you get what you pay for in Rome. This is a fantastic location, just off the spanish steps and the room was clean and the room was a decent size. Everything in the room was funtional and they had a nice terrace to sit outside and drink wine. No thrills but a very safe bet if you are saving money but dont want to sacrifice cleanliness or location.

Reviews.Title: “Classic case of you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: BoothEmma
Reviews.Content: Before booking our hotel in Rome we spent hours on the internet going through all the hotel on various websites and in the end booked Hotel San Marco due to its location (which is less than a 5 minute walk from the train station) and the price. We weren't particularly expecting much from the hotel with the price of it compaired to many of the others in Rome but when we arrived we were plesently surprised. Our room was clean and very spacious with a seating area to watch tv, a dressing area and a resonably big bathroom. Although the hotel was in the middle of a big city once inside the room it was reasonably quiet and a massive bonus of this hotel was that each room has an individual air conditioning unit which can be controlled by the occupants rather than by the hotel. The location of San Marco can't be faulted, there are several small restaurants on the streets around the hotel so we never walked more than 10 minutes when going out for our evening meals and all of the food we had was very nice. If you don't mind walking most of the bigger tourist attractions can be walked to or both of the metro lines pass through the railway station so everything is easily accessible. There are a few downsides to the hotel though, the carpet in the main stairway was exceptionally dirty. Luckily we went up to our room for the first time in the lift, otherwse i think this would have completely put me off staying there, so i would advise everyone to always use the lift! The breakfast isn't great, it only really comprises of cereal, bread, jams, cheese, ham and scrambbled egg. Some fresh fruit or yougurts which might have been nice. There is only 1 mirror in each room, located in the bathroom which isn't great if one of you wants to be getting ready to go out whilst another one of you is in the shower. One other slight problem we had is that you only get supplied with 1 pillow each rather than the usual 2, so we didn't find the bed particularly comfortable. Our towels weren't changed the whole time we were there. One of them had a dirty mark on it which i dont think was from us and although i kept leaving the towel outside the bathroom door or in the bath it was never changed for a clean one! As i said at the start of my review we risked booking a cheaper hotel because we knew that with to much to see in Rome we wouldn't be in our room for much of the time and overall i think the risk payed off. There were several things about the hotel which could have been improved on but our actual room was good enough for what we needed. I think if i went to Rome again i probably would stay in Hotel San Marco as we definately thought it was reasonable for the price. Just as a slight aside about Rome, it can be very expensive when you buy things like bottles of water and ice-creams so we found that it was always worth going slightly off the beaten track to find the reasonably priced supermarkets. As an example we payed 2.5 euros for a standard small bottle of water near the colluseum and 8 euros for a standard ice cream cone near the spanish steps whereas from a supermarket we managed to get a bottle of water for 50 cents. Also if you're planning on going to the vatican museum its well worth prebooking your tickets on the vatican website. When we arrived there just after 9am the entry que was huge but because we'd booked our tickets we walked straight in!

Reviews.Title: “Need a big lesson on service. Website is misleading!!”
Reviews.Author: GemandNath
Reviews.Content: We booked online with this hotel based on the information they provide on their website. When we checked in, a non English speaking lady escorted us to our room which turned out to be kn the 5th floor of an apartment block around the corner from the hotel on a different street! They told us to return to the San Marco hotel for the breakfast but we sleep in the apartment building. When I questioned them on this, they said quite rudely that it's VERY clear on the website and I would have been aware I was booking in the separate building. I was not aware and it was only printed in the tiny fine print. Wi fi only worked at the bar area at San marco. NO HOT WATER FOR OVER 24 HOURS! So the hot water in our room when off twice, once for more than a whole day! The 1st time it was quickly fixed as someone in a different room complained, 2nd time we realized it was gone again, picked up the phone to call reception at san Marco round the corner - PHONE didn't work! Walk round to San Marco to complain, NO hot water again, they rudely raised their voices at us (the 2 clowns on the desk) and said it would be fixed later, they did not seem at all concerned and wanted us to go away. Finally later that day water was fixed so we could wash, my husband had 1 cold shower while there. Breakfast was pretty good. Staff have terrible attitudes (you're just a tourist not a welcomed guest) room very basic, AC worked etc.. Good location for the sights, one metro stop from train terminal and 3 stops from colosseum and the forum.

Reviews.Title: “A superior 3 star”
Reviews.Author: rhoda_mort
Reviews.Content: They cancelled our initial stay as they were having a water problem. But they arranged for, and paid for a replacement hotel and the cab to get us there. The replacement was a 4 star. On our return to Rome, a week later, they provided excellent accomodations. Although San Marco is billed as a 3-star, it was superior to the 'replacement' 4-star. Gets me wondering what 'stars' mean in Italy. Very minor negatives: The elevator is rather small;, the nice bar was never staffed for a post-sightseeing libation; breakfast was just adequate. All inall, woudl highly recommend for price, location, friendly staff, cleanliness and facility maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel with poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Balikat
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Hotel San Marco after I made error in reservation at nearby Hotel Canada. Like chalk and cheese these hotels. Room good size but dark and spartan, there was second room with 2 single beds (good for family). Service good but minimal. Breakfast awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Disgusted_GuestDubai
Reviews.Content: Definitely value for money, good location, and nice breakfast. Roma Termini is just 10 minutes away by walking. Down the hotel is a restaurant that serve nice pasta dishes with some musicians during weekend. I just fell in love with Rome and Hotel San Marco adds more spark into it. Only negative comment is the reception staff who is not that friendly and accomodating. Overall, Hotel San Marco completed my stay and I would definitely stay in that hotel when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “best cheap and chic choice in rome”
Reviews.Author: georgesandra_2000
Reviews.Content: spacious rooms, great great breakfast, very polite staff and near to termini station also to the castro pretorio metro station!!!!!! absolutely recommended.....!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, lacked service and space.”
Reviews.Author: Samwise187
Reviews.Content: Night staff was rude and spoke loudly on the phone at night and the walls are paper thin. They were frugal with toilet paper (had to ask for refills) but kind enough to offer soap and body wash -often hotels in Europe do not. Replaced clean towels daily but rooms are tiny - double hardly large enough for2 adults - no room for luggage. Tv didn't work- which wasn't a pain for my stay but upset other guests during that time. Expect you to checkout earlier than time listed on reservation and ask that you pay in advance -a little strange. Great location though... Most hotels in the area are much pricier. Don't expect them to saddler with any concierge services. Just not their thing I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: bogdanb
Reviews.Content: PROS: 1) Good location: – close to Termini and other transportation, but not too close to have crowd of passengers; – many restaurants in neighborhood with a good quality/price ratio; – not far (but no close) to many historical attractions; – not far from via Nazionale with good shops 2) Very good breakfast with a great (for 3 star hotel) choice 3) New renovated rooms with a comfortable and clean bathroom (not large but comfortable), with good quality towels exchanged daily 4) Friendly service 5) Good quality/price ratio (for 3 star hotel in Rome) CONS: 1) Lack of soundproof windows, street noise can be a problem in a night: noisy drunk quests of a nearby bar and noisy motor bikes 2) Breakfast room a (little bit) too small for a number of hotel quests 3) Dirty staircase

Reviews.Title: “Closeness to the Termini is the best quality”
Reviews.Author: jeffstefano
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel San Marco before and after our escorted tour with Appian Tours (whole other story) and the hotel was surprisingly very close to the Termini Station. The front desk staff was very helpful in all question that were asked and the speak pretty good english. The rooms were average at best but they were clean. I wasnt use to the multiple toilet bowls in the bathroom until my partner explained what the other one was for. The breakfast buffet was ok for the most part though not spectacular. Overall it was not a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, poor location”
Reviews.Author: nicko_jess
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Marco was picked out by our travel agent, I wish she chose a different place. The location was the worst part, we were on foot most of the time in Rome, except the odd tour bus or metro train, so this place being out of the touristy spots was a bit of a hassle, the breakfast was very nice tho, quite large selection!! The room was big, bathroom well appointed, we had no issues with that. The concierge were nice, one of the ladies recommended a restuarant for us and it was very nice, we got discount too because of her recommendation. The price was right, so if location isnt an issue for you this is the place for you, if you're after something central to all the tourist spots, this is not the place for you. We are youn fit and healthy, but it was towards the end of of 3 week honeymoon so I guess we were a bit worn out by this stage.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodations for a visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: mjackson33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to two metro stations (Termini and Castro Pretorio) and easy to get around. The hotel itself is just average, but you have everything you need. Comfortable bed, A/C, and internet access for 10 euros for your whole stay flat rate. Breakfast was a good spread. The hotel is just a little outdated and a little run down. Bathroom needs some upgrades we had a leaky shower. Overall it was exactly what we thought we paid for, a three start hotel by the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: Haynezey
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this hotel for my husband and I to start our 16 day tour of Italy honeymoon. I was very disappointed when we arrived at the hotel. The rooms are so small and the elevator can barely accommodate two people. The location of the hotel also leaves much to be desired. It's so far away from everything in Rome that a 15-20 euro cab fare is required and there is always traffic. I wish our travel agent advised us to stay elsewhere for the start of our honeymoon. The AC in the room was terrible as well. The positives that I have on this hotel was that the room was clean and the hotel staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: arj_ind
Reviews.Content: Clean Hotel, Very help ful staff like the russian girl at the reception. However there was an italian lady who was a bit rude. Its just a walk away from train station getting to and from Roma Termini is very easy. Breakfast was good and well served. The decor and the size of the hotel is very average. Good for a budget traveller. Extremely small elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romelover68
Reviews.Content: All is first class. Rooms nice and clean. Everything is working perfect. Breakfast is excellent. Staff all ower very helpfull and correct. Absoluty recommended

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, Great Location, Good Breakfast, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: poundy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and have nothing but praise for it. It is in a good location, only a few minutes from Termini (for Buses, Metro and airport bus). The area is not on the tourist trail but plenty on restaurants in the surrounding area. It is a good base to explore the city. We asked for a large room, on a high floor and were given a corner room on the top floor (these are bigger). The whole hotel was clean and modern....except the lift but it was good enough and the staff were professional and friendly. Breakfast was good with a wide choice, ranging from Bread to meats (hot and cold), eggs, fruits and even cake. A well run hotel, and we would recommended it, especially for the price. Many thanks for a nice stay,

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: Ozjane
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the single rooms for 8 nights and am happy to recommend the hotel. The hotel itself is great, the rooms, breakfast, the cleanliness all perfect. The outstanding feature though, is the staff. My first visit to Rome was wonderful experience because of the hotel staff. particularly Natalia and Franco. Nothing was too much trouble as they helped and guided me through all the issues I needed help with, not just in terms of hotel amenities but getting around Rome and finding the specific things I needed. I think what was particularly important to me was the genuineness of their assistance, they really cared, it was important to the staff to help me, they didn't just go through the motions.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magig
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within 15 minutes (with luggage) from the railway station. It was clean, had a varied breakfast and a reasonable sized room plus a lift. And the soundproofing worked - so important after 13 hours on a plane. While there was a bit of a walk to Rome's attractions there was also the Metro at the railway station. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan1113
Reviews.Content: A good hotel; nice ammenities and nice/quiet room. Prompt check in, friendly staff, and a very good breakfast. 10 min walk from the central station in the direction opposite to the heart of the city, making the walk to the main sights even longer (though there is the subway at the central station of course). We are young and active and so this was not a problem for us, but for certain guests, this would be a big con, I think.

Reviews.Title: “San Marco OH NO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: orlimar
Reviews.Content: April 24 2008 My wife and i have just returned fom Rome after a 4 day city break staying at the San Marco Hotel. First lets get the GOOD POINTS out of the way 1 The Bedrooms and bathroom are VERY Clean with fresh towels every day 2 The hotel is in a very GOOD position 500 meters from Termini station and Metro etc 3 Plenty of restaurants very close with reasonable prices 4 Reception staff friendly and helpfull THATS IT BAD POINTS 1 THE WALLS ARE PAPER THIN you can hear EVERYTHING from snoring to midnight abloutions doors banging,draws slamming,toilet flushes from 3 rooms down the corridor TAKE YOUR EAR PLUGS for a good nights sleep 2 BREAKFAST now here is a different episode compleatly Lots of previous reviewers stated what a great breakfast it was WRONG there are 2 RUDE staff that run the Breakfast struggle Cerial bowls run out so you have to WAIT until the female member of staff has snapped at you WAIT Im Cleaning them oops sorry for asking then Cutlery that is left on your table is picked up and placed directly back in the basket for the next guest to use WITHOUT being WASHED you have to get your own tes and coffe for the machine which is foul tasting.The fruit juice is a DEFINATE NO NO it tastes like diluted anti freeze thats if you can get some before the waiter BARKS Therez a no a more ees run out. The scrambled egss are made from POWDER as in world war 2 The cutlery to the eggs are NEVER changed I could go on even more about the BAD hygene practices in this breakfast room but i think you have probably got the gist of it by now My wife and i are extensive travellers but i have never seen any food practices like this beforein any of the hotels or countries we have stayed in Any way we had a great time in Rome seeing all the sights etcand some Great FOOD OUTSIDE OF THE HOTEL CC Apri 2008

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome, Hotel + My Gf for treating me!”
Reviews.Author: streak222
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome with my Girlfriend for a long romantic weekend. We were not disappointed with either the Hotel or Rome and would highly recommend both! Easy Jet Flights - Nothing to exciting to tell you about - About a 2 hour flight from Stansted to Rome Ciampino Airport (the other airport is called Fiumicino, don’t get them confused!) Transfer from Airport to Hotel - We decided to grab a Taxi to the hotel as the queue for the Bus was long. Taxi is a good choice, they are legally not allowed to charge you more than €30 for any destination in Rome city centre. Our fare cost €28 to the hotel and took less than 30 mins, even in Rome traffic. (If you ask the hotel to book you a taxi, they will book you their own private car at €50, make sure you ask for a White taxi for when you leave the hotel - no need to book on your way to Rome, Taxi rank was full on arrival) Hotel - My girlfriend cancelled our first choice hotel after finding San Marco on the web at a great price. The price we paid was incl Breakfast, 3 nights and 4 days. Worked out to be just over £60 each in total. Hotel Reception was clean and we were met by the owner who spoke excellent English, all other staff also spoke excellent English and were always happy to help and answer questions. Hotel Lobby is small but with a nice bar which serves drinks 24 hrs. They also have a TV room which looked nice but we never used it. We were on the 6th floor in a corner room, 620. not sure if this made any difference compared to the other rooms, but our room was very big. Although Bed was two large singles pushed together, the bed was very comfortable. TV with good selection of films if you wanted to pay for it. Nice sofa and table in corner to use if needed. Bathroom was big and very clean, tiled floor with drainage so you don't have to worry about drying off in the shower - It looked brand new. Views from the room are what you expect in a city. Pls note - Floor 2 is being refurbished, although work only takes place Mon-Fri - Also 7th floor was being built on, but this did not ruin our stay. Breakfast - Was excellent, huge choice of food from fruit, toast, eggs and cakes, all served fresh from 7am till 11am. Eating out - Do try the local restaurants around the block from the hotel, great food and 10% discount if you ask for a card from reception. Average price we paid each night was €30. Watch out when going out for Lunch, you will probably be in a tourist area and the bills can be very high, we were charged €50 for a small lunch on our first day, we didn’t make that mistake again and made sure we went off the main roads to find cheaper establishments. Location - Hotel is a good 30 mins walk to the Coliseum or Trevi Fountain. The train station is 5 minutes away and you will find the Metro here which will take you across Rome for €12 each for a 3 days pass. You will need to jump on the tube to go to the Vatican unless you enjoy a long walk. Great value for money. Print off a tube map before you go as some maps in Rome did not have these on them. The Map given out in the hotel Lobby is very good and easy to understand. Sight seeing TIPS - I would recommend you book your entrance fees before you go for both the Coliseum and Vatican. My girlfriend booked ours for the Coliseum and the Vatican. Because we pre-booked, we did not have to join the long queues, it costs a little extra but well worth it, the queues were huge. We turned up at the Vatican, a Tour guide met us, took us pass the queue and then kindly told us where everything was, then left us to it. 3 full days was just right to see everything in Rome, although your legs will feel very well used! Safety - I could not of felt safer in Rome, Police were on every other street corner. Hotel has the German Embassy down the road so we got 24hr armed police walking near by, which made you feel very safe walking around at night near to the hotel. Tubes were also well staffed and although you get the odd beggars selling Roses etc, they didn’t bother you too much, a quick NO and they walk away. If we went back to Rome, then I would be happy to stay in Sam Marc again, Staff were friendly, hotel was clean, location was excellent, this was Great Value for Money! Feel free to ask any questions. Thanks Chrissy for taking me! I owe you!! x

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Termini Station, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: karenKent_england
Reviews.Content: The S.Marco is only around seven minutes away from the station and the bus stop where you get off the Terravision bus if you use it from Ciampino airport as we did. The price was reasonable, the hotel is a small one and there are a few restuarants nearby , ideal for having a relaxing meal after an exhasting days sightseeing On arrival we were allocated our room by a friendly receptionist. The room was very clean and although looked out to buildings at the back, was quiet and a view was not important to us as we were out all the time. The bathroom was all new and the shower was lovely. Fro breakfast there was a good deal of choice of breads,pastries, scrambled eggs etc. We walked almost everywhere, apart from when we went on an open topped bus tour on the first day which gave us our bearings. We picked this up from the Termini station, it was a good way to see everything. Rome is an amazing city, there is a historical building or monument everywhere you look. The highlight for us was seeing the Pope from five feet away, when we went to St Peters Basilica and he was conducting a Mass there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldyrome
Reviews.Content: myself and a friend stayed at the San Marco Hotel in rome in july,it was a fab hotel we could not fault it. The staff were all very friendly and made us feel really welcome. we travelled from newcastle, and couldnt believe the nearest metro station called The Termini was only approx 8 min walk away from hotel. The room was very spacious had a balcony new bathroom with shower everything was spotlessly clean.And what can i say about the breakfast it was unbelievable scrambled egg bacon croissants cheese ham fruit and wonderfull home made cakes.We definitely recommend you stay here.oh i almost forgot they have a room specially for luggage to stay which is locked ! so if your flight is in the evening and u hav 2 be out hotel by 11am you dont have to trail your luggage with you.

Reviews.Title: “A large clean room”
Reviews.Author: dhutcho
Reviews.Content: Though this is our 6th trip to Europe it was the first time we booked our hotels through the internet. The hotel San Marco was our fist stop and we had booked a double room for 2 nights. The location was perect for us and only a 7 minute walk from the Tremini station. The room we had was large enough to have our luggage on the floor. It was clean and well furished. The bathroom was also better than other hotels we have stayed in europe, with nice hot showers. The area had resturants handy (in fact we ate just downstairs). Though the streets were noisy when we had the window open. once closed the room was nice and peaceful and we enjoyed an interupted sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Marco
HotelInfo.Address: Via Villafranca 1, 00185 Rome, Italy
